40940229.review:
感谢野蔷薇给了我这次测试机会，感谢。
全金属狂怒评测
游戏简介
Cellar Door Games开发的多人冒险过关的独立游戏，于2018年1月17日发行。
+出色的职业多样性
这四种职业完完全全可以把游戏改变成四个不同的游戏，他们分别是坦克（盾娘），工程师（眼镜妹），斗士（锤娘），狙击手（想不到外号了）构成的复仇女神，干掉四个泰坦的故事。剧情老套，只能疯狂加梗，让对话不那么单调，并且中文汉化较好，很多梗做到了本土化。


为了消（zheng）灭（jiu）泰坦，四个妹子组成复仇（ou）女神（xiang）

每个职业都有四个技能，鼠标左键普通攻击，鼠标右键特殊技能，空格用于逃跑，f大技能。
四个职业差异非常明显，坦克和斗士勉强可以说有一些相似点，他们的普通攻击只有前后之分，而另外两个和这些完全不同，因为他们要用到鼠标360度控制方向，即便这样，他们还是在普通攻击上有区别，狙击手的攻击距离基本上是全图，没有距离限制，而工程师则是扇形攻击，但是距离有限，刚上手鼠标控制方向的话，可能会很不习惯，因为你搞不清楚轴心在哪里，要转多少方向才会变化。但是对于单通，远程职业有着无可磨灭的优势（不用键鼠操作的话）。当然有小伙伴的话，要好弄多了。
+超多彩蛋完美加入，细节有打磨
撸猫（现在游戏不出个撸猫的彩蛋真是不好意思和人说话，但是猫也是导路员），组建乐队（同时承担解密任务），包括锤妹防反失败会有哭泣脸，以及不同的场景，营地也会产生相应的变化，比如在平常休息时围绕着篝火，但是到了沙漠地图里，休息地方就是围在风扇旁边，你可以看到出很多小细节都是制作组用心的地方。


四人乐队，但这并不意味这所有的彩蛋都没有意义，很多还与解密关系
+解密元素很炫酷
这个解密元素，要先发现石碑，再去解开石碑的秘密，最后才能去一个超酷的云上的一个地方输入密码。一环扣一环，很有意思。
+音乐很好听
做了个收音机，可以欣赏所有bgm。在单人战斗中，如果过于专注战斗本身，根本注意不到这些歌曲的旋律。在营地里，调调收音机听听bgm，也是一件很有趣味的事情。
笔者最喜欢的是rest in the forest和rest in the ruins，但是这俩旋律好像一样，如果不是重名，那就应该是制作组偷懒了吧。


小时候的逼王说，垃圾收音机里的歌少，好收音机里的歌多
+人物性格设定明显
戴眼镜的永远是回答问题的那一个，使用重武器的锤妹永远喜欢用最简单的暴力方式解决问题，盾妹总是故事情节的推动者，担当领导者的作用，然后狙击手有着敏锐的观察力，他们在台词上费了点心，但是对于这种游戏，没必要每一关都要有对话，有的时候强行尬聊恐怕不是一件好事情。

自己吐槽支线任务
+本地化很好
提供了简体中文，而且梗也能对应上，例如中文绕口令什么的。看得出制作组对于中国市场的重视，或者是对中国玩家的友好。其实不翻译也没什么，战斗过程并不需要中文，只不过会错过很多有趣的段子。

技能树与装备选择设定
被动技能的提升意味着等级，这往往意味着等级多很多级并不一定会形成压倒性的优势，等级的意义不是特别明显，与获得攻击，属性等技能相比，功能性的技能更好。

用金钱购买的被动技能，决定了你的等级

每个主动技能都可以得道具强化，有点类似暗黑三符文的感觉，轻微改变技能形态，让玩家在不改变职业特点的情况下，将职业变得更顺手。


虽然道具多，但是只能选一个用
等级系统有待完善
没有经验值的设定，仅靠金钱升级的技能去判断等级，并不能很准确的判断角色的战斗能力，印象中所有的怪都会掉钱，钱的另外用途就是获得的道具还需要钱的二次解锁才能用。

画面
角色是像素图，背景贴图是手绘，云端和星河设计的大气磅礴，令人影响深刻。闯关的部分的画面也很好，森林，沙漠也创造出了对应的氛围，过场对话出现的头像和背景绘画风格一致，风格可爱近人。上手很容易对这种风格产生好感，尤其是配上人物有趣的对话，创造出一种轻松愉快的氛围。



多人游戏是欢乐休闲游戏，单人游戏成为硬核游戏？

一关一关的走，游戏流程总共有六章，如果有基友10个小时主线流程差不多

单人模式真的非常非常硬，非常困难，要不然不停地刷赚钱，否则就只能在游戏中等cd了，很小心谨慎的攻击，这样会使游戏流程极其漫长，总之单人游戏会很辛苦。这可能会和键鼠操作有关，鼠标控制攻击方向不是很流畅，但即便使用了手柄，从伤害数值上来看，单人游戏也是一件很困难的事情。游戏设计师加入的怪物仇恨指引机制，但是对于单人来说，这个根本用不上。斗士F的时候不能静止，方向键只能改变移动的方向，必然向某个方向走；一定要有坦克，只能靠她架盾救人了；两个远程职业的射击方向，鼠标操作莫名其妙。可能这款游戏在设计的时候，就倾向于让玩家组队，并且推荐用手柄。


独特的鼠标控制方向机制，可能改成以撒一样的键盘控制会更好

对于单人来说，怪物似乎有点困难，boss真的不好打，但是如果你喜欢复活，这些到也可以接受。在没有等级技能压制，一场游戏下来，你的死亡次数不见得比怪物死亡次数少，而且这还是在怪物数量很多的情况下。


必备骚操作之架盾救人

存在降低难度的故事模式，但是不会提醒你单人游玩是否选择，一般人可能并不会发现，而且难度降低的并不是那么明显。


为什么不直接让我们开始游玩的时候选择难度，非要藏起来，做成一个彩蛋

单人主线略单调，就是不停的打怪，相比之下支线任务作为主线的调味剂要有趣的多，但是支线太少了，和鸡蛋里的熊猫一样。


不打怪物的支线真的是很有趣

类似植物大战僵尸的奖励设定，每打一小关，给一个装备道具，但是这些道具很多是冲突的，并不能都用上。如果想达成全收集，就要多注意观察，游戏设计者把他们藏在一些场景中，事实上不看攻略真的不容易找到。


每个小关关底的奖励，有些是功能道具，有些是装备的

*本游戏不得不提的创新点——彩色屏障
这是一种我以前没有见过的强行增加合作性的方式，在单人模式中似乎有点鸡肋，为了保留这一设定，改变为换职业才可以攻击，增添了游戏的难度，在游戏中，你可以看到五种不同颜色的屏障，除了白色对应无敌，其他四种颜色分别受到不同职业的攻击才能受到伤害。（在打单人模式的时候，我在想要是主角也有这样的屏障就好了，让怪物感觉一下自己有多恶心。）


Boss也会有彩色屏障，而且屏障颜色还会变化，对于单人游戏来说，难度大大提升。


联机
不存在在线匹配机制，必须要是好友才可以联机，这直接导致了不容易组队，论坛里或者游戏评价里很容易见到求组队的人。如果没有好基友一起联机或者没有准备赠送好友游戏，对于个人来讲，除非是特别爱好这种类型游戏，不然游玩过程会很累。很遗憾，在笔者游玩的过程中，并没有找到小伙伴，所以很难评价过多，只能靠脑补了。


总评：
单人游戏体验7.5/10
真的难，需要很肝，而且操作很谨慎，不停的重复打怪，刷金币，升级，而且不能急于通关，做好慢慢玩重复刷的准备。

游戏素质总评8.5/10
总体上来说，作为一款独立游戏，虽然单人流程难度有待调整，多人模式如何寻找队友也是难点，但是难以掩盖其优点。创新性的加入彩色屏障系统，但是这个系统还有有待优化，如何在增加合作性和游戏性的前提，不让玩家觉得麻烦，是一个值得考虑的问题。音乐，画面，人物设定，以及从提供中文的诚意上来看，仍不失为值得一玩的作品，尤其是有小伙伴更加推荐了，这款游戏很多设定都是只为多人准备的。

40886714.review:
评价来自野蔷薇
2018-03-17
来自于《盗贼遗产》工作室原班人马打造的全金属狂怒，是一款想当有趣的四人合作清版游戏，本作为你提供了4名个性鲜明的角色供你游玩：

大姐头肉盾，相当强劲的肉盾角色，突进和战吼两手控制屌的一批。

阿宅科学家，剧情中的线索提供者，突进是翻滚，使用转轮手枪（右键三连），大招召唤无人机（炮塔），emmmmmm，麦克雷啥时候和托比昂搞一起了？

粗线条战士，斧子攻击力强，跳劈自带回避（但是距离超短），大招是战士们的看家本事——旋风斩（小兵也会用，真的掉身价...）

天然呆狙击手，比起狙击手，更像是猎人，闻气味就能追踪泰坦的存在，普攻大招全都得蓄力，在分秒必争的本作里显得有些咸鱼，突进是一条射出去的钩锁，有着三笠阿克曼的感觉，右键地雷没啥大作用。

我个人是找不到steam好友来联机的，所以只能单机玩，个人觉得单机带上肉盾科学家是最好用的。

剧情：世界毁灭吧啦吧啦，摧毁四座泰坦巴拉巴拉，清版游戏介意啥剧情啊，虽说反派都刻画的很可爱就是了。

画面：优质的像素画风与可爱的立绘相结合，我个人打90分。

音乐：在营地里的时候较为缓和轻松，在战斗时激昂曲目可以燃起你的热血，尽管打完过后印象不会太深，但是在游戏中的表现足够好。

战斗：本作打击感扎实，游玩起来酣畅伶俐。在操作上，近战就是惯常的清版街机模式，远程则是双摇杆的操作模式，小关卡选取，清完版面前往下一个区域，这些最简单的特性还在。本作敌人最大的特点是会根据你所操纵的角色生成护盾，因此单机的时候切换角色是必不可少的。

难度：难，作为单机的话很难。（但是存在剧情模式，降低难度，在大地图上按esc来修改。）

角色养成要素：收集金币，解锁各自的技能树，打破关卡，获得各自独特的武器，这两要素要是肝起来的话就不得了了...

缺点：1.汉化不走心，又一个机翻（不过好像有点润色）

            2.联机网络太差啦！还限定steam好友还行！

            3.我觉得战士这角色是不是太弱了点啊...

            9/10 独立游戏精品之作

40820857.review:
I like a lot of this game but I had trouble finding it fun. The women in the group are interesting and fun to play. The items and the way leveling works is good. The thing is playing alone is too difficult and the mechanics work against you.

The color shield mechanic forces everyone to be present and active but could make play one-sided if only one color is left. It's not like you can't hit the enemies, it just won't do any damage. This could lead to situations where one play is really bored. Also in single-player it gets frustrating that you have to switch back and forth between two characters. It's even worse when one of your characters is down. The shield just clutters up the screen with the same color as the character and gets in the way of a fun action game.

Since I only recommend picking this up if you're going to play co-op you should know that the characters do not interact with each other besides resurrections. If you do want to play single player make sure to turn on story mode. Trust me.

Complete video review: https://youtu.be/pVMLBO_svzo

I can say nothing else but this game *feels* wonderful and is a experience I miss from older games with coop as a main feature such as, Left 4 Dead and Halo.

40766896.review:
This game is a fantastic multiplayer experience. Each of the characters fill different roles, meaning that coordination and cooperation is critical. The colored shields (enemies that can only be attacked by a certain player) do admittedly slow gameplay down at times, but they also create some wonderfully tense moments when the lone surviving party member is running around, frantically trying to revive their teammates while being attacked from all sides by enemies they can't damage. I'm not a huge fan of the level-up system, but it does give you the option of grinding to overcome a particularly hard level.

One of the best co-op experiences I've had.

40752602.review:
Having played through the game with 2 friends, figuring out all the secrets on our own, then doing NG+ solo, and then moving on to speedrunning this game, I absolutely think that it is a blast. Fans of Castle Crashers will feel right at home here, with similar gameplay, personally I find the gameplay much more rewarding than that of Castle Crashers.

The game had a bit of a rocky launch with some connection issues, all of which have been fixed now, and the game plays very smoothly both solo and coop, so whether or not you have friends to play with, or someone to sit on the couch and play  with, a mixture of the two, or just want something to do to destress on your own at the end of the day its a great choice. 

This game is difficult, I'm not going to sugar coat it in the slightest, its hard, you will die, and die again, but the action is fast paced and whenever you do die the game throws you right back in really fast, and you lose no character progress when you die, so you will always get stronger no matter what, which allows for even some younger or inexperienced players to have fun and not feel stuck while playing. 

Musically this game is very well done, and the character dialogue is very good, and pretty funny, however some people disagree on that point, depends on whether or not you like one-liners really. But if that isn't for you, you can disable all non-essential dialogue (so 99% of dialogue) in the options menu. I highly recommend however, that you do the first playthrough with dialogue on, then future playthroughs it is up to you.

All in all I thoroughly enjoy this game, and will continue to do so for the forseeable future, so if you are interested pick it up, and give it a shot. 

One more thing, there is currently no lobby system for multiplayer, its all through steam invites right now, however the devs have stated that the next patch, which is coming soon, will remedy this, so if that's a deal breaker for you, wait til patch day and then give it a shot.

40626238.review:
非常感谢[url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/255962] STCN鉴赏家[/url]提供的游戏。
[url=https://steamcn.com/t366554-1-1] 图评[/url]

游戏剧情
故事情节很老套，也很让我懵逼。
国王驾崩，普罗米修斯死了，泰坦们掀起了争夺继承权的战争；长达一个世纪的战争，使我们的世界化为灰烬，幸存的泰坦们忙于招兵买马、重建军队，让世界得以喘息。
为了让世界避免灾难，四位姑娘组成了“复仇女神”团队，消灭了四位泰坦，然而战争依旧不停息，“复仇女神”们仍旧奋战不休！
老实说，这个剧情非常老套，就像美国经典的西部牛仔片，看到开头就能猜到结局，一路的过关斩将换不来和平，战争永不停息。
为了弥补老套的剧情带来的弱项，制作者在对话中不断加入各种梗，同时指出战争并不是解决掉4个泰坦就能平息，而泰坦们也并不是战争狂，只有都有着各自的想法，比如喜欢科技的泰坦科俄斯，宣称这百年战争期间的科技进步远远超过普罗米修斯在位的1000年。
游戏共分为6章，分别为
1.	猎杀墨诺提俄斯
2.	乌龟与陷阱：进入佛洛伊森林，寻找乌龟泰坦科俄斯
3. 迷宫、井与冥河：穿越迷宫，决战角斗场
4. 第二面墙与第四面墙：干掉泰坦科俄斯
5 遗忘之境： 勇闯亚特兰蒂斯
6 最终错误：决战泰坦勒兰托斯和泰坦恒行星克洛诺斯
游戏角色和技能
游戏中共有4个角色，单人战斗每次可选2个角色，可在战斗中进行角色切换；多人战斗最多可选4个角色。
每个角色都拥有4个技能，普通攻击、第二技能、逃生技能（一般用于快速远离战场，免疫部分伤害）以及强力技能（能量攻击），其中逃生技能和强力技能都有技能冷却时间，可升级减少，本来打算在角色介绍中写出每个角色的技能，但该游戏中并没有明确技能介绍，同时技能所带伤害也是升级可变的，因此很难在短词语中解释，所以期待玩家体验。

姓名：特里斯
职业：坦克（近程）
基础攻击：盾击
性格：作为队长，坚强，常常为队员加油鼓劲
 
姓名：艾琳
职业：工程师（中程攻击距离）
基础攻击：猎枪射击
性格：团队中的智慧担当，收集情报
 
姓名：梅格
职业：狙击手（远程）
基础攻击：远程射击
性格：呆萌，常年走神，貌似嗅觉灵敏
 
姓名：亚历克斯
职业：斗士（近程）
基础攻击：锤击
性格：天性乐观，一般对话都是由他开头

游戏设定
 
有些敌人拥有屏障，只有对应颜色的玩家才能打破屏障。
坦克——蓝色屏障
斗士——红色屏障
工程师——绿色屏障
狙击手——橙色屏障
白色护盾无敌
游戏模式
游戏分为单机和联网两种模式。

游戏操作
强烈推荐使用手柄操作，打击感和流畅性更佳。
 
游戏评价
1.	欢快愉悦的BGM
游戏在不同界面配置了不同的音效，不得不说，游戏制作者在音乐选取上很有意思。比如说在游戏的选取角色界面，锣鼓喧嚣、鞭炮齐鸣，给予玩家一种将军即将征战四方的刺激感；再如暂停界面的音乐，阵阵的掌声加点电子琴的声音，悠扬且带着教堂婚礼前奏的喜庆；在游戏的战斗界面，鼓点激烈，琴声神秘。笔者对于音乐不甚了解，但对于循环听近20个小时都不腻味的BGM，确实了不起。

2.	两种绘画风格相结合的游戏场景
在此款游戏中，制作者采用了多种绘画风格，在描绘人物和游戏场景时，采用的是像素风，图中披着风衣的特里斯持盾站立在宝箱旁，宝箱、木桶以及人物都采用了像素风格，轻松可爱，而远处的树林和近处的围墙、木箱则偏向于日漫风格，玩家若不认真观察，很难察觉到场景和人物之间风格的不同，制作者近乎完美的将两种绘画风格结合到一起，玩家不出戏，个人猜想是由于场景整体风格统一，但用像素风的角色点缀，非常有趣。

 

同时在各种对话界面，制作者又采用了另外一种绘画风格，图中的泰坦科俄斯偏向于美漫，采用多种色块，简单涂抹将人物展示出来，显得格外俏皮可爱，即使是反派，也不会显得凶恶；采用明暗对比说明对话的主体，不至于分不清说话人。这种风格的绘画对于玩家具有强烈的视觉刺激，从而加深对于角色的观感。
 

3.	流畅而爽快的打击感和对手残友好的难度设定
游戏中角色技能的多样性，带来了非常爽快的操作手感。对于笔者而言，更喜欢采用特里斯（坦克）和亚历克斯（斗士）拳拳到肉的近战角色搭配，其中特里斯的普通攻击为盾击，第二技能为坚韧，逃生技能为冲锋，强力能量技能为咆哮（游戏中的技能名称并不是这个，笔者认为翻译并不精确，文中采用这种让玩家一目了然的技能名称）。而这些技能在使用时，想必是经过了制作组多方调教，战斗中的技能使用酣畅淋漓，无论是盾击还是冲锋，那种流畅的打击感让人很舒服，战斗时就有那种确实击中实体的感觉，爽快！
在我游玩此款游戏的前12个小时，作为一个手残玩家，一直奋战在第一关卡的boss战，沮丧之下发现游戏设置内隐藏的游戏调整→故事模式，仿佛发现了新大陆。非常有趣的是玩家可以在任意时候修改游戏模式，比如说boss战结束之后可以调整回普通模式。故事模式下的boss和怪物血量、攻击以及AI都有明显降低，而回血道具数量增加。前期的普通怪，常规模式下需要5-6次攻击，而在故事模式下仅需3次攻击即可消灭，大大降低了玩家的卡关几率，为手残玩家带来非常好的游戏体验，而故事模式带来的惩罚则是金币获取数量的减少。
4.	丰富的游戏内容和有趣的正反馈机制
这款游戏内容之丰富也是我玩过的游戏中比较少见的。制作者将升级、收藏、解谜、跑酷等多种机制相结合。
（1）	技能树，玩家可以通过消耗金币，升级角色技能，增强威力，减少冷却时间。
 
（2）	装备：玩家需要在各类场景和boss战的宝箱中获取装备设计图，并在营地中消耗金币获取新装备。
 
（3）	解谜机制：制作者在第一章节的多个关卡隐藏了石碑道具，而在道具附近也都会有提示，如“此路不通”等，玩家能否领会全靠天意了。
 
（4）	过关模式：游戏中过关并不完全依靠战斗，个别关卡考验玩家的操作，颇有种跑酷运动的意味。
 
（5）	宝物收藏：玩家可在解谜关卡或者boss战后的宝箱中获取宝物，当然，宝物的作用约等于零，不过满足了玩家爱收藏的要求。
 
（6）	战利品共分机制：玩家所获取的回血道具和冷却时间清除道具，所有角色之间互相共享，在单人模式下差别不大，但多人模式下就非常有趣，有效避免了玩家争抢道具，团结就是力量。
同时，游戏采用了一种有趣的正反馈的机制，即玩家在关卡战斗中即使失败，也会获取相应的经验以及关卡中收集的金币，这也是我乐此不疲刷12个小时的第一章节的原因，因为不至于失败就一无所获，玩家依靠失败关卡获取的经验和金币，迟早也能靠自己通过关卡，带来的成就感也是十足。
 

游戏评价之缺点
1.    游戏中有趣的颜色屏障设定
这种屏障设定在多人模式时比较友好，也是这款游戏的特色之一，保障了每个角色都有对应的怪物攻击。但在后期，各类屏障小怪充斥着屏幕，一眼望去，全是红的蓝的圈圈。
在单人模式中，这种设定则显得非常不友好，因为玩家可以在战斗中更换自己选择的角色，但若是不巧，其中一名角色死亡，场上的怪物都是这名角色才能打破的屏障，虽然具有复活机制，但需要较长一段时间，玩家可能是能望障叹息，因为没法打，只能四处躲避，等待另一名角色的复活，死亡几率较大，此时玩家体验较差。

2.    仅限好友合作的联机模式
这款游戏第二个奇葩点在于多人模式只能在好友间进行，不能网上团战，而我的好友中还没人拥有此款游戏，不愿意加陌生人的我只能看着多人模式空流泪。非常期待制作组能在后期将网络和本地多人模式添加，弥补此项缺憾。


短评
这是一款侧重多人团战的动作类 RPG 游戏，流畅而爽快的游戏打击感，多样的场景变换和绘画风格，有趣呆萌的复仇女神，逗比可爱的各类反派，丰富的游戏内容，即使在联机功能上有待加强，但这是一款非常值得推荐的良心之作。满分10分的话，我会给予8.5/10的评价。

40429542.review:
「ベルトスクロールアクション + タクティカル + ハックアンドスラッシュ」

●物語
"フューリーズ"とは、
「センチネルのトリス」・「メカニストのエリン」・「スナイパーのメグ」・「ファイターのアレックス」
で形成された少数尖鋭部隊のことである。
彼女たちは暴徒化したタイタンの謎を解き明かすべく、四つの世界を股に掛けることになる。
アーティファクトに記されたメッセージを手掛かりに、タイタンたちの実情を受け止め自由を勝ち取るのだ。

※断片的な解釈でしかないので、英語が読めた方が楽しめられます。
　僕はある程度しか読めなかったので、この程度ですみません。

●クリア時間
15～17時間。アクションが苦手な方はレベル補正で勝負することになるので20時間はかかるかも。

●ゲーム内容
ハックアンドスラッシュをベルトスクロールアクションにした作品。
アクション7割・RPG3割で構成されている。
マリオワールドのようなステージクリア方式で、隠しエリアもある。

チーム制になっており、ソロプレイでも二人のキャラクターを選択交代しながら戦況を変えていく。
青の「センチネルのトリス」、緑の「メカニストのエリン」、橙の「スナイパーのメグ」、赤の「ファイターのアレックス」
と特性共に色別で差別化されている上、'色別判定バリア'によって分担作業が必要になる。
なので単独行動でクリアできないよう必然的に交代を迫られる。

'色別判定バリア'とは、敵を包むバリアのことで色別で剥がせるキャラ対象が決まっている。
面倒に思えるが、一度剥がしてしまえば他のキャラでも攻撃が届くようになる。

レベルを上げるにはお金が必要になる。スキルツリーで消費すればレベルを上げれる。
キャラ別で使用できるスキルは決まっているものの、追加効果は装備品によって変わってくる。
そこはハクスラ要素に関わってくるのか、上手くスキルを使いこなすことも要求される。

他にも、どの装備品も使ってもらえるようにする為か'マスタリーレベル'というものもあり、
装備品を使用すればランクが上昇、パラメータに相乗効果を与えることが出来る。

難易度は選択不可能、普通でも難しい。
「レベル補正頼みか、スキルの特性頼みか」で調整していく必要がある。

尚、凶悪なパズル要素もある。英文が読めないと厳しい。
読めても外国人の方が「クリア後にパズル要素で時間がかかった」と仰っていました。
なので素直にウォークスルー参照を推奨します。

★この作品は「強くてニューゲーム」有りです。
これだけでもやりたくなる方が増えるのでは。

★オフライン協力プレイ時は二つのデータが必要になります。
「一つのデータから、一つのチームを二人で協力」はできません。
二つのデータから一人ずつ選んでチームを組みます。
なのでオンラインの場合でもそうですが、レベル差が生じやすい現状です。

●プレイ感想
クリアしてから、良作だと断定付けられる「面白かった」という感覚が込み上がりました。
ソロは楽しいですがスルメゲーです。スキル要素等見た目はハクスラなんで。

特筆すべきは、タクティカルとアクションの整合性。
兼ね合いもあってか、ハクスラ要素(スキル能力による補正)が良い感じに効いています。

是非とも協力プレイを楽しんでほしいです。非常に楽しいのでお勧めです。

デザインアートも好きで、「女性だけのメンバー」というコンセプトが気に入りました。
エロティシズムな見解はなく、女性の自然的な個性を感じられました。

良い点ばかりを上げたので、気になった点も上げます。

▲気になった点
△難易度が高め。
アクションが苦手な方はレベル上げで時間がとられるかも。

△キャラの性能差が少々感じられる。
とくに「ファイターのアレックス」。ジャストガードスキルは乱戦時に厳しい。
デビルメイクライのダンテが使うジャストリリースを狙い続ける感覚になるので難易度が跳ね上がる。
「センチネルのトリス」が万能すぎて、他のキャラとの組み合わせでは必ずと言っていいほどトリスが必要になる。
「スナイパーのメグ」と「ファイターのアレックス」を組み合わせてしまうと大変。

△装備品の性能差も感じられる。
スキル能力が大きく進行具合に反映するので、使わない装備品(スキル)は本当に使わない。

△状態異常サイレンス
サイレンスとは一時的に全ての所持スキルを使えなくする状態異常のことであり、一番の被害者は回避行動そのものがスキルになっている「スナイパーのメグ」と「メカニストのエリン」となる。
更に「スナイパーのメグ」にとってはサイレンスは非情なもので、
射撃後の隙を逃がすために回避スキルがあるのに成す術がなくなってしまう。

△ハートクリスタルの暗号パズルが分かりにくい。
非常に分かりにくい。というより分からない。
外国人のウォークスルーを観ていると、しどろもどろにウロウロしている場面があって「分かるかいな」
とボヤくぐらい。
それぐらい面倒で、スーパードンキーコング3の洞窟ミニゲームぐらいで良かった。

▪結論
非常に楽しい作品です。
少々高かったですがわざわざ8000円払わなくても充分に、いやそれ以上に楽しめられます。
他の作品にはない何か魅力があります。
特に協力プレイは試してほしいものです。「任せろ」とか言いながらフレンドとやりました。
慣れれば雑談しながらも可能ですし、本当にお薦めです。

FMF takes one of the most beaten and brawled genres and turns it into the de-facto co-op experience. Initially, my partner and I pirated this game and played it through (Sorry! Sometimes it's hard to take the money gamble) but it didn't take long before I knew I'd be slapping down the dollarydoos for it. 

It's surprising how complete a package it is: mysteries, puzzles, great combat, diverse cast, humourous and serious writing, great asthestic, banging tunes, responsive controls, couch&online co-op, and a refreshing take on the 2D beat-em-up genre. Game is a serious labour of love, and it deserves a lot more recognition then it's currently getting.

Is it flawless? Nah, but nobody cares when the rest of the product is 10/10.

40287101.review:
Full Metal Furies is easily the most engrossing action beat-em-up I've played. The gameplay mechanics are refreshing, engaging and above all else, very fun. The game is just the right amount of challenging, and failure isn't some crippling experience - you feel encouraged to try again and again on more difficult sections. The writing is campy and amusing. Each character feels incredibly unique in how they handle combat. Solo players are given two characters to swap between, which is instant and leads to extremely satisfying combos. There's an "RPG-Lite" leveling system that gives the feeling of constant progress and rewards. And everything is tied together nicely with appealing visuals, satisfying sound design (that pinball ping is the best) and a treat of a soundtrack.

Seriously, playing by yourself or with friends, this game is just stupidly good fun.

40215865.review:
Full Metal Furies is pretty clever. It's a beat-em-up designed from ground up for co-op, yet plays fine solo too. The arenas are huge, the enemies are varied, attacking over various areas with various patterns, the pace is all Castle Crashers or TMNT arcade, but the core combat is something unique.

You have four characters with different movesets, two melee fighters, two ranged fighters. They only have one basic attack string, but they have a few command moves on top of that for dodging, turret laying, heavy attacks, or what have you. The command moves can cancel... this is important, so important the game stops you and tells you about it twice. A lot of the game is footsies, then, trying to get past enemy attacks and hit your combo on them and cancel into a command move to either get out of there from the other enemies closing in or to get some air juggle bonus damage on the enemy you smacked. The result will never be as crazy as a Platinum game but is far more thoughtful than Castle Crashers ever was. Even better, you unlock alternate attacks for basically every button/move for every character to give you some real customization.

Solo play is done with a tag button, allowing you to swap between two characters.

As the Rogue Legacy devs did this, there is of course a massive meta grind of constantly pouring cash into your stats as well as leveling up each move, and a NG+ if your grind is that important to you to have another round of it. The need for buying grind points for each girl makes it tough to play as everyone, sadly.

Still, a fine game, with friends or by yourself, it's certainly not a blend of game design you've seen in this genre before.

40210127.review:
Rogue Legacy's developers trade roguelites for a co-op brawler/bullet hell kinda-sorta-not-really based on the Greek Titan mythology. Unlike a lot of games in this subgenre, it's got four characters that all play very differently and have their own equipment and skill unlocks. Both of those add even more variety to the game - equipment unlocks add all sorts of advantages and drawbacks to your attacks, and skills progress through smaller versions of Rogue Legacy's stat tree. 

Most of the stages are about three screens of increasingly difficult fights against standard enemies (of which there are probably around 10 species) followed by a boss. These can get very difficult, but you keep any currency you gained before dying, and there are plenty of optional levels, so you've got options if toughing it out isn't quite your style. Combat is theoretically pretty simple since you only have four attacks, but they do a fantastic job of shaking up scenarios to prevent you from ever getting comfortable with a strategy, and the skill ceiling is very high. 

Normally these kinds of games are only really satisfying in co-op, but Full Metal Furies gets around that by letting you pick two characters in single-player. You can instantly swap between them at any time using R2, which opens up all sorts of interesting possibilities for comboing and balancing health. Enemies will often spawn with a shield that can only be destroyed by one of your characters, and those shields can change color as they take damage, so learning to swap well is absolutely necessary to progress. It's a great system. 

I don't think anyone plays this genre for the stories, but FMF is actually pretty solid on that front as well. It has a very silly sense of humor that almost always worked for me, but everything is skippable if you'd rather it just stayed out of the way. Regardless, none of the scenes are very long. 

Unfortunately, while I always had enough currency to level up both of my characters (Sniper and Engineer) once or twice after missions, I don't think it's possible to keep more than your player count up to level without replaying levels. I didn't have a problem with that, because I loved playing a team of all glass cannons, but mileage may vary. Also, the true ending is locked behind a sequence of clever puzzles that I'm not really convinced work with this genre. Finding all of the hints requires going back and meticulously exploring the backgrounds of older levels, which I found needlessly tedious. Again, mileage may vary.

40178399.review:
This is a seriously underrated gem. That said, it's also really, really goddamn hard. Don't be fooled, this isn't just Castle Crashers' cousin; this game is a brawler + a shoot 'em up, where you're typically going to be 3-hit in the most convoluted, evil battle scenarios and boss fights.

Plenty of unique levels, content, gear customisation, stats to go deeper into your character, secrets to uncover, challenges to complete, bosses to conquer. A good level of polish to the sprites, environments and artwork in general. Each character is incredibly unique in their playstyle -- like, absolutely no overlay between them and, depending on what gear you put on your character, you can vary and specify your playstyle to a fine point.

There's some questionable writing here and there, typically running with the lowest-common-denominator joke and delivery, but it's all in good fun and doesn't detract from the game or the nature of the story itself -- worth reading if you want to feel a little more invested in the characters and surrounding world.

My only real issues with this game are from the difficulty. I know that sounds like a limp-wristed thing to say, don't worry. But the sheer length of some fights and the composition/design of some enemies [i]really[/i] digs into your skull when every second is a painful reminder that this game wants to kick you to the ground. Beating the odds for 5 minutes, only to be backhand-slapped from half health, then knowing you have to repeat the fight, is something that requires both a lot of skill and a lot of mental fortitude to get over.

Aside from that, I do feel the difficulty is aided by the often apparent amount of visual cluster. There will be you, several enemies, coloured shields, flashing sprites, telegraphed warning icons, explosions, solid environmental objects, bullets, bullets, bullets, dashing effects, a gigantic boss, massive laserbeams, invisible snipers, etc. It can be incredibly hard knowing where you are. In fact, when playing with my friend, we both play with colourblind mode [i]on[/i], despite having no problems with our eyes, just so we can have the added benefit (despite being more cluster) of seeing drawn lines between [i]us[/i] and the coloured enemies that we're assigned to kill, so we don't lose track.

Not a perfect game, but still remarkably underrated.

I have played Full Metal Furies with three groups of people so far; one three-player game and two two-player games. I've played as a different character for each, and each experience has been really fun and rewarding in its own way. This is a game with a whole lot of potential for different play styles thanks to the equipment selection mechanic, and even two players playing the same character will have a very different experience depending on how they like to use their abilities!

FMF reminds me of a cross between Gauntlet and Moon Hunters in the best possible way. It's a really satisfying couch co-op experience that has us going for "just one more try" on the harder fights without becoming frustrating. The writing is consistently funny, the art is charming, and the soundtrack is great. I would highly recommend picking this one up.

40029118.review:
8.5/10

Full Metal Furies really nails the gameplay. There are some other issues here and there, but the gameplay itself is beyond reproach. The four classes that you have access to are quite distinct: each has four separate abilities, and each ability has four total variants. You can also "level up" each variant to gain an account-wide bonus (bonuses that will apply even if you switch characters) to HP, attack damage, special attack damage, and gold find. Lastly, you can use the gold that you find to put points in your skill tree. The skill tree allows you to either modify or enhance your abilities, or can give you a flat bonus to either your health, attack damage, or special attack damage.

Unfortunately, I felt that many of the ability variants were clearly inferior to others, and found that many of the skills in my skill tree weren't very interesting. With the sniper class that I played (Meg), I changed my grappling hook to a shield bubble, but otherwise used her starting abilities for the entirety of the game. In other abilities and skills there seemed to be this focus on shooting enemies out of the air for additional damage, but this just didn't seem like something I could execute reliably. One weapon option for Meg was a sniper rifle that took so long to reload that I thought it was jammed, and another sniper rifle that lacked a laser sight. As certain enemies in this game are quite small (turret bots) and others almost invisible (snipers), your laser sight is absolutely invaluable when it comes to making your shots count.

The other issue with the title, at least for my co-op partner and I, was the inclusion of a bunch of obtuse puzzles. To reach the actual end of the game, you'll need to input funky symbol passwords over and over again into these computers in the clouds. I think there are perhaps ten of these computers, and the clues for their solutions are found both in-game and out. It seems that players are expected to find "stone tablets" hidden in the game's levels in order to solve the puzzles. We stumbled upon a handful of them, but nowhere near every one. Luckily, we were able to scour Youtube and Steam forums for the solutions, but it was irritating to have our fun game periodically interrupted. Perhaps some players find this to be a fun scavenger hunt (one puzzle solution is found in the game's release trailer), but for us it was mostly exasperating.

Fortunately, none of this really matters, as the moment-to-moment gameplay is so engrossing. The game is tough, and will require you to use your abilities often and well. You'll learn which enemies to prioritize, and about each enemy's attack pattern and vulnerabilities. In addition, certain enemies will emerge with a shield of a certain color. The character of the corresponding color must put damage on that enemy before his or her co-op partners can begin damaging that enemy. Although I read that certain reviewers found this gimmicky, I thought it was absolutely genius. It enhances the amount of focus that combat requires - is your cooperative partner getting swarmed by enemies that only you can damage? At the end of every single play session, my co-op partner and I commented, "man that was great." What else can you ask for in a game?

The game also has a great sense of humor. Each character has their own personality, and often we literally laughed out loud. The meta-commentary and randomness of some of the enemy encounters is really charming. Additionally, the game features good level design, a standout being the Babylonian desert. Lastly, and most importantly, there is a cat with goggles on in your camp that you can pet whenever your co-op partner is taking too long with his skill tree.

39805067.review:
Full Metal Furies is an action game that would be an absolute classic if it was released in the 90s. It achieves quite a lot - it gives new life to an old-school genre from the 90s (Beat'em Ups), the gameplay has an amazing flow (smooth responses, big brawls with frantic action) that becomes really addicting fast, and also great silly sense of humor and likeable heroes and villains (if you are not too offended by all the silly humor and childish puns going on!). 

And above all, the multiplayer really shines! Just like the old Beat'em Ups, it's a bunch of fun to cover your buddy beat a lot of baddies together, but FMF adds it up with with different character classes, shields who can only be broken by specific players, revive and aggro mechanics and custom combos. That's all put together in hectic boss fights on a challenging and difficult game, but one that strangely doesn't feels too frustrating when you fail together and try again. Maybe because it's a joy to play together, and also because the RPG mechanics smoothe things a bit.

And the end game is amazing. Behind all the ridiculous jokes, the silly dialogues and the frantic and non stop action, is hidden an epic (!) of complex puzzles(!!) and a reflection on the dangers and limits of ideology(!!!).

Maybe the only thing that is holding this game of being an instant classic so far is its release. This game had a very bad launch, with nasty network bugs, and the absence of means to quick-play multiplayer with strangers (missing features like Online Matchmaking, or even a multiplayer Lobby). A Beta was sorely missed. The Devs have noticed these problems, though, and seem to be making a good job of quickly fixing what has to be fixed.

All put together, FMF is an amazing game, that seems like it was made with a lot of care, and you wouldn't be too surprised to see it in almost every 'Best of 2018' lists that are going out there.

This game is a fantastic co-op experience and one that I can see myself playing and re-playing quite a bit with my friends. I found this on accident scrolling through the co-op tag, I misclicked, looking for something new to play with my pals. This seemed similar to castle crashers, which we loved to death and figured it couldn't hurt to give it a go.

The gameplay is quite spectacular. Nobody ever feels left out or like the "useless character" that can often accompany these sorts of games. Each of the characters are unique and have a clear role, but you can change them up so much by mixing around your equipment, which is half the fun imo. The leveling system is solid, finding equipment is fun, puzzles are great and the dialogue is A+ material. Seriously, the one liners and the general humor is some of the best I've seen. 

I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a new co-op game to blast away with their friend or friends. I can't speak for the solo experience, but this certainly feels like a game you don't really play on your own.

It's a shame the game doesn't seem to be selling so well, it's quite a treasure. It seems to need more publicity, I had never heard of it until I stumbled across it. I own and enjoy Rogue Legacy, but I was completely unaware of this games existence.

39763283.review:
Cellar Door Games frappe encore un grand coup avec Full Metal Furies.

Ils ont réussi à renouveler le beat’em up en proposant un titre prenant et très complet.

L’aventure est vraiment longue, intéressante, bien écrite et à côté de ça le jeu regorge de contenu avec quatre classes de personnages vraiment différentes, de nombreuses compétences à acquérir, des arbres passifs à remplir, des niveaux bonus en pagaille, des secrets à découvrir en résolvant des énigmes, etc.

Chose géniale, la coopération entre les joueurs est vraiment mise en avant avec un système de combos aériens et de boucliers colorés obligeant une parfaite synchronisation.

39701088.review:
TL;DR: If you are into brawlers and/or co-op games, I highly recommend this one. Best enjoyed in co-op.

I've been [i]trying[/i] to write a review for this game for a while now. But everytime, I just booted the game up instead and enjoyed it a bit more. Now that I've finished it twice with a friend, here are my humble opinions about the game. 

Full Metal Furies takes the traditional brawler formula and improves it greatly with its own style. The new mechanics that are introduced highly enhance the gameplay, and also encourage co-op to a degree. There are four characters that you can play with, and each character comes with their own set of arsenal and offers wildly different gameplay options. 

If you are planning to play this game solo, you are allowed to select two characters, and can swap between them at any time. However, I [i]really[/i] recommend that you play this game with at least a friend, if possible a full party. As I've said, this game is best enjoyed co-op. 

The game also offers some puzzles that are quite clever. Some of these puzzles require you to think out of the box a little, while some others hide in plain sight. Solving them was both challenging, and fun. Of course, if this is not something you'd like, you can always check out the guides section and get the answers from there directly. 

The story is better than I expected. Actually, much better than I expected as I started the game with zero expectations of liking it at the first place. The humor is right on the spot; quite a few of the dialogues made us laugh out loud actually. And it doesn't overstay its welcome; it knows where / when to stop, and avoid taking it too far and have the opposite effect.

The graphics made me feel awkward at first, but I've grown to like the mixed style in time. If you don't like what you see, I can totally understand that, but you'll be missing a lot if graphics are the only reason that makes you not interested in the game. 

The music; its soundtrack is almost 2 hours long and with 41 different tracks, and it never got old in our playthrough. I'm somewhat of a soundtrack junkie, and pay extra attention to the music of any game, and this one is simply excellent.

Few of the players unfortunately experience networking issues apparently, but developers are at hard work trying to solve any issues that they find / are reported. We didn't experience such issues, and aside from some odd game bugs here and there, our playthroughs were steady. 

As I've said at the beginning, if you are into brawlers and/or co-op,  I highly recommend this game. And don't forget that it is best enjoyed in co-op. All in all, I think this game is a gem. I hope you'll see it and enjoy it too.

I'm not a great gamer, but I love to play co-operative games.  However, I found brawler games like Castle Crashers, Final Fight, and even Marvel Alliance, really really dull.  I could barely stay awake while playing them with friends @_@ 

This is not the case with Full Metal Furies!  The barrier system meant my contributions were actually signficant and meaningful and I found myself very engaged in the game.

Also, the game's leveling up system allowed someone, like me, to tailor character traits that bolstered my weaknesses and allowed me to play how I liked (e.g. I can't do the counter on the Fighter for the life of me - but I was able to cooperatively beat the game as the Fighter, by bolstering her health and strength and relying on other abilities, rather than depending on being good at countering).

This is a fantastic game!  I highly recommend it! 

(Note: I initially played - and beat - the game locally with a friend which is why I don't have many hours on record).

From my perspective, mainly playing with friends, but also playing solo at times, it really does feel like a cross over between Cellar Door Games Rogue Legacy (which i loved) and Gauntlet: Slayer Edition (which my friends and i also loved). 

The real strength from this game, and most games like this is the couch coop gameplay, a few mates, drinking beer and trying to get through the next level, even if repeating some levels to get the gold to power up a little more. 

The storyline is fine, but unless im playing solo, my friends and i just skip the dialogue to get to the game play, in which i think Cellar Door Games did wonderfully by supplying an option to skip the dialogue, which is sometimes funny to read, but mainly aimed at a younger audience. 

8/10 

Hope that they release some DLC for this, including new characters and skill trees.

39620203.review:
Listen, if you enjoy side scrolling beat em ups a la Castle Crashers, Scott Pilgrim Vs. The World, etc., then you will LOVE this game. I've always loved those games, but I was rarely able to finish them due to the repetitiveness of the levels and same-ish enemies, but this game takes all that and kicks it up a notch while remedying those gripes. The enemies are diverse and challenging each in their own way, the levels are varied and beautiful, and the challenge (IMO) doesn't come from just throwing wave after wave of clone mobs at you; the enemies are smart, they dodge you and don't just soak up damage like fodder, and they have skills that stack with each other to make each screen a CHALLENGE. This game makes you think on your feet and utilize all of your skills and combos. There's just a touch of RPG elements in there too with unlockable skills and items that change how you play, as well as stat upgrades and boosts. ON MY FIRST NIGHT OF PLAYING I PLAYED 5 HOURS STRAIGHT. IT'S LIKE THAT.

My only two gripes here are that there is no online lobby (invite only) currently, but there's a Discord with people always looking to match up, so if you don't have any local friends or steam friends with a copy, I'd suggest the DIscord. Also the resolution at 1080 or higher is less than perfect. The dialogue text becomes a little blurrier, but the action and character sprites don't seem to be affected (again, IMO). It's not bad by any means, especially for the pixel art style that it rocks, but it could use some love and attention in a future patch.

GRAB DIS GAEM.

39599003.review:
Seems like it could be a fun co-op game, but the graphics are painful.

The game mixes highly pixelated graphics, which are the characters and interactable elements of the game, with cleaner graphics for background scenery.

From the looks of it, the non-pixel graphics were made for 540p resolution and picking any higher resolutions just causes the whole game to be stretched up to that resolution. This is most noticable with the text, since it's super blurry and hard to read.

Additionally, all the pixel graphics are not screen pixel perfect, which causes a waving distortion when moving, as some pixel data is lost as the pixels no longer take up a full pixel. I believe the camera can zoom in and out, so this is bound to happen, however this is mostly only a problem as the rendered graphics are scaled up, rather than rendered larger. If it was rendered larger, then there would more pixel data available and any loss of pixels would be less noticeable.

39591594.review:
Basically Castle Crashers meets Rogue Legacy.  Essentially, a side-scrolling brawler with RPG elements added, such as acquiring new gear that provide unique bonuses or skill augments, leveling up, talents trees, and permanent stat boosts as you level up and progress.

PROS:
+ 4 unique classes each with distinct play styles
+ RPG elements give the game a lot of depth
+ Weapon system encourages experimentation and exploration to find them
+ Rogue-like aspect means you can eventually conquer harder levels by replaying previous ones to get gold and level up
+ "Bubble" system, in single-player, adds a strategic layer to combat, forcing you to switch between characters to take down certain enemies

CONS:
- Difficulty of combat. While you can replay previous areas to level up, the combat is usually frantic and it can be hard to predict enemy attacks, especially when 2+ enemies attack at once (which is common). Combat feels a little sluggish/slow which is kind of frustrating.
- No open online co-op. You have to play with friends locally or invite people from your friends list.
- Need to replay earlier levels to tackle harder levels. While I like that you can eventually get stronger through pure attrition, it can sometimes get annoying to have to replay the same levels multiple times.
- Not enough skill diversity. Would like it if they mapped more skills to other buttons to give your character more options in combat. You basically have attack, counter, power-attack, and dodge.
- "Bubble" system is frustrating in co-op play. If an enemy is a certain color and your teammate of that same color is down, that enemy will not be stopped until that same color player is revived.

This game has a lot of potential. I can still say i'm enjoying it after 7+ hours of play but the difficultly along with the sluggishness of combat is a bit irritating. It's very close to scratching that brawler/RPG itch but just isn't quite there yet, for me. 

Despite my complaints, I would still highly recommend this to people that are a fan of the genre as it's one of the best ones to come along since Castle Crashers.

39590785.review:
[h1]¡Las Furias en acción![/h1]

Si os hablo de Cellar Door Games quizás algunos no sepáis a quienes me refiero, pero si os digo que se trata del mismo estudio que hace unos años nos brindó aquél excelente rogue like titulado Rogue Legacy, la cosa cambia ¿verdad? Pues bien, este es su segundo trabajo, Full Metal Furies, un título del género beat 'em up, en el que eso sí, también ha participado en su creación los chicos del estudio catalán BlitWorks (Fez o Jet Set Radio) y eso se nota sobre todo en el argumento y los diálogos, como ya veréis más abajo.

La premisa argumental en un juego de este tipo nunca suele ser nada del otro mundo más allá que una excusa para lanzarnos a soltar mamporros. Pero este no es el caso, ya que rompiendo con esa tónica, en Full Metal Furies contamos con una trama mucho más elaborada de lo habitual en un beat 'em up. Somos las Furias, un grupo de chicas guerreras que luchan en una eterna cruzada por devolver al inframundo a los terribles titanes, unos seres muy poderosos basados en la mitología griega. Pero no os asustéis, no es una trama pesada, sino al contrario, muy fácil de digerir pues en ella impera el humor más absoluto, con unos diálogos cargados de cachondeo y que en muchas ocasiones serán desternillantes (en otras ingeniosos a más no poder). Pero por encima de todo, muy bien escritos y perfectamente traducidos a nuestro idioma, se nota mucho el trabajo de los barceloneses BlitWorks en todo lo relacionado con la historia del videojuego.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1279204646

Pero pasemos al aspecto que más importa, su jugabilidad. Como ya os digo, se trata de un beat 'em up y el soltar galletas a diestro y siniestro será una constante. Es un juego muy pensado para jugar en compañía de nuestros amigos (en red u online) y será posible juntarnos hasta 4 al mismo tiempo. No en vano, el grupo protagonista está compuesto por 4 chicas, cada una con sus distintas habilidades diferenciadoras. De todas formas, también es perfectamente viable (y divertido) jugar en solitario, el juego se adapta a ello, aunque se nos obligará a jugar con dos personajes, pudiendo cambiar entre ambos muy rápido con tan solo pulsar un botón, creando así estrategia entre nuestros dos personajes en forma de combos y demás. Si caemos podremos resucitarnos con el otro personaje (o nuestros amigos si jugamos en coop), fallando la misión solo si todos los personajes caen.

Otro aspecto muy destacable de Full Metal Furies es que, debajo de su aparente simpleza, esconde un juego muy elaborado que combina el género beat 'em up con el del rpg, así pues, mientras vamos avanzando por su trama e infinidad de misiones secundarias, iremos adquiriendo experiencia, oro, subiendo niveles y desbloqueando multitud de habilidades y equipo para nuestros personajes. Lo que al principio parecen solo unas pocas y simples habilidades o equipos a desbloquear, pronto se transforma en múltiples formas de cambiar y mejorar a nuestras guerreras a medida que subimos niveles y desentrañamos los muchísimos secretos que esconde el juego.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1280342241

Y es que esa es otra, Full Metal Furies está plagados de contenidos que poco a poco descubriremos, incluso sus escenarios, lejos de ser los típicos de este genero, no consistes solo en avanzar hacia delante, en muchos de ellos hay bifurcaciones y zonas secretas, lo que hace que también sea un juego de exploración. Además, suelen ser variadísimos, no solo en aspecto, sino también en lo que hacemos en ellos. Lo mismo estamos machacando oleadas de enemigos, que sorteando un campo de minas, escapando a toda velocidad de un bombardeo o luchando contra originales jefes finales, que por ciertos, nos van a apretar bastante las tuercas. Desde el minimapa nos iremos adentrando en los diferentes niveles y tras superarlos con éxito regresaremos al campamento base donde podremos gestionar el grupo, el equipo, acceder a la tienda y muchas sorpresas más que no comentaré.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1279205062

El combate en teoría es muy sencillo, tenemos 4 botones, el ataque normal, otro de área, una esquiva y la defensa, pero esto en conjunción con las diferentes habilidades y equipos que desbloquearemos para posteriormente equiparnos, dan como resultado, personajes muy diferentes entre sí, más allá de las simples diferencias de cada clase de los personajes (una es la tanque, otra la luchadora cuerpo a cuerpo, otra la de apoyo y por último la de a distancia). De esta forma podemos por ejemplo tener una tanque que pegue como la que más o bien un muro andante, según equipemos ciertas habilidades y equipo.

[h1]Análisis completo[H1] http://www.mediavida.com/foro/juegos/analisis-full-metal-furies-602359#1

恰到好处的联机难度及带来的正向反馈。除了要熟悉BOSS每个阶段的技能以外队友之间还要有良好的沟通配合。灭了好多次四个人终于DOWN掉BOSS之后YY里的欢呼喜悦真是比摸到了自己的装备还要来的强烈。

敌人的多样性保证了游戏的耐玩度。不断有不同的敌人出现，不同的特性需要团队用不同的方法处理。

隐藏的解密元素。我们一直在研究石碑的谜语和云里的电脑密码。

扣分点：
1.线上联机不稳定
2.8个半小时已经过了1/3的流程，很担心流程过完就没有别的东西可以玩了。也许以后会开放创意工坊，加入更多关卡、BOSS、装备、敌人和职业以丰富游戏内容。

39533563.review:
Отличная игра для кооператива.

Сложность не дарк соулс, конечно, но на некоторых уровнях заставляет ощутить теплые чувства в районе чуть ниже спины. Неоднократные траи одного и того же уровня вам обеспечены.

Механика геймплея не такая простая, как может показаться на первый взгляд. Применять вовремя уклонения, прыжки и прочие скиллы нужно, чтобы не грести без вёсел, как в одной небезызвестной реке. Чтобы эффективно наносить урон, придётся освоить местную систему воздушных комбо, где, за попадание по врагам, находящимся в воздухе, даётся хорошая прибавка к урону.

С каждой новой главой в кампании появляются новые враги, скиллы которых вы ранее не видели. К каждому из супостстов придётся подбирать свой подход из раза в раз, иначе рискуете покинуть игру с дымящимся задом наперевес)

Элементы РПГ позволяют прокачать каждую фурейку под себя. Считаете себя ультра скилловым нагибатором - качайте дамаг, уклонения и ни очка в здоровье. Хотите держать 10 попаданий артиллерии подряд и постоянно задавать врагам вопрос "И это, по твоему, удар?" - вложенные в хитпоинты очки вам в этом помогут.

Ваш перекат кажется вам слишком коротким и вялым?? Успешно найденный рецепт поможет вам увеличить длину вашего переката и сделать его более мощным, ценой частоты его использования. За всё нужно платить)) Любой навык можно изменить на похожий, но с другими свойствами, чтобы он больше соответствовал вашему стилю игры. Что очень помогает с разнообразием игрового процесса.

Стиль рисовки пикселявый и очень миловидный. Взрывы, персонажи и котики в тактических очках хорошо анимированы и радуют глаз))

Музыкальное сопровождение не выбивается из общей картины и только прибавляет эффекта погружения)

В общем, очень классная игра для кооперативного прохождения. Играя вдвоём, получили очень много положительных впечатлений и эмоций. Рекомендую.

P.S.: За 10ч игры прошли меньше половины. Над разнообразием и продолжительностью разработчики постарались, за что им спасибо.

和好友联机打了好几关，完全没有遇到任何BUG啊。安利一波。
因为游戏的机制，我主玩的狙击手，感觉狙击手手感比较好，瞄准方面熟悉一下就没问题了。
目前打到第8章，武器解锁了一个AWP而已。AWP上弹时间比较长，但可以通过逃生技和放置炸弹重置普攻，输出爆表，比较推荐。

Rogue Legacy(《盗贼遗产》)创作团队全新推出了一款讲求“个人主义”的动作类 RPG 游戏。FULL 
METAL FURIES(《全金属狂怒》)强调个人操作，玩家在其独特的作战系统中自己扮演一个团队。凭操作单吃一切敌人，一人多线操作触发团队连击以造成大规模破坏，拯救世界。可以在沙发上或是在线上独自游戏，组建最多两个可控角色的单人团队！也可以进入在线模式等待不存在的好友加入游戏，通过受伤不能救人，被打飞出地图等设定来展现你的非凡技巧。
游戏特征：
想和朋友共同游戏？不存在的。
最多一名玩家加入冒险，只支持离线模式。
支持从完全沙发模式到离线模式之间的任何一个程度。
想要自娱自乐？预料之中。
超级联机系统让你只能自己离线游玩。
游戏中没有团队。全金属狂怒中....只有个人。
必须单吃才能击败敌人。
你只能复活自己，不能复活队友。
这是独角戏，而非合作。
再也不用为了等补刀、抢黄金、分血瓶而争斗。 所有东西都是你自己的，你可以集中精力游戏。
四个角色，四种不同游戏风格。
但你只能选两个用。
堇张刺激的战斗。
正义潜行，光明背刺，神圣飞刀的敌人。
一段关于古神的冒险，在火逐渐熄灭的时代里等待着不死人。

39507274.review:
Full Metal Furies actually exceeded my expectations. With it being so obviously designed for co-op play I thought it may not hold up too well in single-player. Whereas I did play some local co-op, more often than not I was playing solo and actually really enjoyed it. 

The ability to pick two characters to switch between is a brilliant mechanic and stops the combat from getting stale. With how levelling works in the game it's possible to level up all characters evenly and switch between them regularly, too (though I imagine you'd be strongest if you just focused on two characters instead).  

One of my favourite aspects was the progression system, in fact, as it feels really satisfying to level up your abilities and gear, and doesn't take too long to do so. I think this was what really kept me hooked. I've written a [url=http://www.indiegamewebsite.com/2018/01/20/full-metal-furies-review/]full review of Full Metal Furies[/url] elsewhere if you'd like to read it. All in all, I definitely recommend the game.

39495701.review:
After playing the game from start to finish, clearing each stage and solving each riddle to 100% I really have nothing but praise to give this fantastic game. 

From a gameplay standpoint, each character is incredibly unique and allows you to find the playstyle that fits you. Triss (my favourite) can combo her ground-controlling launches and can protect her party. Erin has rapid, mid-range DPS and can toss in her trusty crowd-control drone. Alex is the whirlwind fighter who gets feverishly into the thick of things and grows in utility as you master her counter-attack and Meg's the backline powerhouse, who deals serious damage but requires a level of mastery to play well (so definitely take note of the difficulty STARS when choosing a character for the first time - or make sure you've a strong front-line partner to work with).

The skill trees expand the play range and agency of each character - honing them more compitently into their team role as you learn their style (which is where the RPG component comes into play). A low level Triss, for example, feels really basic in the early game as you learn the basic combos, and have to deal with shield breaking - but as you climb the tree, your talent selections give you comeback, shielding, reflecting and damage negation tweaks that reinforce her "Tank" role and expand the groove of being the shield-weilding frontliner.

The equipment blueprints and masteries are an impressive addition. Equipment changes the way a particular ability plays in general - which at the start is helpful to refine a playstyle that lets you learn the game and the character. As you become more proficient, the mastery system encourages you to switch gear, and learn each new styles to benefit from the stat gains that come from leveling up the item. Both these systems are incredibly sophisticated ways to keep the game feeling new, and addictive - unlike every other "brawler" I've played before, where characters are all the same, and stay stale for the entire game - making it a chore to play by the end. The RPG twist to the genre, with attention to the meaningful action-oriented upgrades ensures you're involved in the gameplay decisions and are constantly learning, adapting and gaining "mastery" as you play. It never gets old.

Enemies are impressive, each offers a clear challenge, with strong AI patterns that are recognizable and comprehensive and that in combination with other enemies, create the ever-expanding difficulty. Even similar enemies later that may look, on the surface, like pallete swaps have additional, and important moves that make them an entirely new challenge. The barrier system is also really smart. While it may initially SEEM artificial, it is a critical part of the game that makes Co-Op ACTUALLY MATTER! Unlike other games of the type, where one good player can just carry you through - the mechanic forces each player to become an important part of the team. In difficult stages, where weaker characters need to take action, it creates a compelling sense of comeradery as teammates have to work together to lock down untouchable enemies, or protect their needed partners so they can get in to break the shield. It's compelling and makes each encounter feel incredibly, co-operatively dynamic!

The writing and story in the game are also something to take note of. Clever, witty banter and puns-within-puns ripple through not just the dialogue in the game, but the menus and overlays as well; giving the game a fun, tongue-and-cheek tone. It's easy with a group of players to want to skip the banter... but if you can, take the time to read it through - there are some good lines that can catch you off-guard, and, as you dive deeper - there is a story that is remarkably and intelligently connected - if you're paying attention. Everything is carefully crafted and expressed - and it can be easy to overlook - not that the game suffers if you do - but it speaks to the depth and the levels this game has. There is care and craft here that the developers have put into expressing a holistic and powerful game experience.

Finally, the puzzles. As a player, they sit on the edge of confusion for a long time - why are there puzzles in this game? Do they matter? Isn't this game just about hitting stuff, and hitting more stuff? Well, I won't spoil anything here, but just as the dialogue feeds the experience with care, the puzzles do the same. And they are fun, mental challenges that once you solve or decipher are often personally rewarding and an unexpected surprise. The game doesn't insult your intelligence, and provides in-game clues to everything - it simply asks you to think outside the box from time to time - which is incredibly rewarding.

I played through the game first with a co-op partner (2P). The back and forth combos, the teamwork, the revive loops were all gratifying and intense experiences that I will remember! 

I've played only the first couple worlds again solo ( as Triss/Erin) and in 4P with my friends (as Meg...HARD MODE!) and each experience has been different and uniquely fun. Solo, it's a pretty satisfying experience to swap and combo between characters for chaining air-crits or save yourself after one character goes down, and in 4P, evading the chaotic bullet-hell of certain fights is nail biting - but every time is a good time.

If you haven't played the game yet, and any of the action from the videos looks like it's up your alley - give it a shot. Once you get it...and then actually "get it", you can't let it go, and it keeps on giving.

39489395.review:
[i]Now listen, I've only played about an hour and a half, and decided to refund - so this is more of a 'first impressions' heads-up review to give a very early opinion. But don't get it twisted, I wouldn't review if I didn't feel like I understand exactly what this is.[/i]

[b][i]Full Metal Furies[/i] is a fresh take on the Beat'em Up genre.[/b] The fighting mechanics are super tight, and work really well. That part is great - and other Beat'em Up games should be taking notes. The controller support is nice too. Other veteran players say that the skill ceiling is quite high, and I totally believe them. I kept getting better and better even over the short time period. Great.

Now onto what I think doesn't work.

The pixel art pieces placed on the 'smooth' art background feels off; perhaps 'bland' is the feeling that comes to mind. Okay, it's just aesthetics so lets move past that. The storyline is pretty 'meh' to me and I quickly found myself skipping through it. The one line jokes are... Not great. Okay, fine. I wish this were more classic action RPG instead of more Beat'em Up. What I mean is that I wish there were randomized loot, an open-ish world to explore (instead of corridors with barrels and boxes on repeat), and less of the 'puzzles' which were  hardly groundbreaking to say the least.  

[b]They say single player is just as prominent as multiplayer - but I can't shake the feeling that it was still pieced together as an afterthought.[/b] Really, how could it not be? I would find it mind boggling to have a game that is *equally* good/fun with four players versus one; apples and oranges, really. Now, single player [i]is[/i] fairly well done, but c'mon guys this is best (and was intended for first and foremost) with four people sitting in the same room. Switching between two characters is 'okay' at best. 

[b]I just simply think that for this price, you (the buyer) had better plan on doing some multiplayer regardless of what the store page says about how solid single player is.[/b]

Now onto something more controversial. The grind. [i]Rogue Legacy[/i] had the meta-upgrades that ended up with a game mechanic that was simply a giant grind. It's very much alive and well in this title too. I knew this going in, so I am not going to dump on it too much, but something always feels slightly cheap to me about that approach. I don't know if the word is 'artificial difficulty' or what, but the idea that it's nearly impossible to finish it on the first run (or first few) just sits strange with me. To be fair, the devs said they could take a fresh build and get quite far (they didn't say 'finish' it, from what I read).

[b]Really, it comes down to the asking price being the deal breaker for me.[/b] While they [i]say[/i] single player is strong - I disagree. And I've played a ton of local couch co-op games, and have a lot of love for that category - and very few of them ever ask $20.

[i]Not a bad game at all. Just make sure you have a regular group to play either local or online before you buy.[/i]

39485597.review: The brief: I'm conflicted on recommending this game. It is a wonderful game that has quite a bit of depth, the story is funny enough, the music is superb, and it is all made better with a friend. I only complain, as many others do, that the netcode in this game at launch is absolutely atrocious. My friend and I were trying to play together and there skipping for me regardless of who was hosting and then there were times where we could ressurect eachother because one of us would be invisible to the other. Also there were times where the enemies would skip around making it impossible to predict attacks. This can definitely be solved with patches, but it amazes me that it is so terrible. If you're playing solo, the game flawlessly, but you lose out on half the fun. Knowing that it was a small team and that they already released a patch two days after release, I have hopes it will be fixed. And for that matter I can reccommend, though I would wait to see a netcode update patch if you plan to play online with friends.

39484574.review:
평가에 앞서 이런 분들께 추천한다.

시크릿 오브 그란디아 혹은 조툰같은 게임들을 즐겁게 플레이한 사람
태양만세
나 게임잘함 아무튼 게임잘함
디아블로3 유저


솔직히 2시간 미만만 플레이하고 재미있으면 환불 후 세일때 재구입을 하려고 했다.
하지만 이미 7.5시간이 넘어버렸다.



장점

1 피지컬을 요구하는 게임.
 게임을 잘하는 편이 아니라 나만 이 게임이 어렵다고 느껴질지는 모르겠다. 보통 한 챕터를 깨는데 한시간정도가 걸리는 것 같음.

2 게임의 몰입감. 영어를 잘 하는편이 아니라 대사도 막 스킾하면서 하는데 시간가는지 모른다 정말로

3 적절한 체크포인트.
 너무 과하게 체크포인트를 주지 않으면서 필요한 부분에 주기 때문에 보스를 잡다 죽어서 다시 도전한다고 처음부터 도는 것이 아닌 보스방에서 부활한다. 게임이 너무 쉬워질거 같다고 하실수도 있지만, 이게임은 동선이  길어서 그냥 보스방스폰 윈윈하는것

4 나름 친절한 지원.
 비교적 컨트롤이 쉬운 탱커와 엔지니어의 스킬파츠가 비교적 스토리 전잔부에 치중되어있다. 물론 파이터와 스나이퍼로 솔겜을 하고있다면 우럿다(본인얘기아님아무튼아님)

단점

1 입력 설정들을 자세하게 하지 못한다.
 버튼을 할당하는 거야 기본적인 것이지만, 마우스 감도를
 조절하지 못하기 때문에 어색 할 수 있다

2 해상도 문제를 지적하지 않을 수 없다.
 콘솔버전을 이식한 것이라 해상도가 흐릿한 것이 거슬릴 수 있다, 800x600부터 3840x2160까지 지원하지만..

3 패드 체계의 컨트롤.
 메뉴를 제외한 인게임에서 마우스 커서의 절대적인 위치가 있는 것이 아닌, 캐릭터가 바라보는 방향으로 기본적으로 커서가 향해있다. 심지어 지금 내 마우스커서가 어디있는지도 모름! 공격을 할 때 특히 나타나는 불편함. 충분히 적응을 할 수는 있으나, 솔직하게 아직도 스나이퍼 에어샷은 힘들다. 

4 꼬여있는 맵.
 3챕을 깨고 진행을 하다가 레벨디자인이 이상하리만큼 적들의 레벨이 지나치게 높아서 의아해 하였으나, 5챕터의 맵을 진행 중이었던 것이었다.. 솔플을 하다가 보스방에서야 뭔가 이상하다는 것을 깨달을 정도라서 그렇게 어렵다고는 하지 못하겠지만, 정말로 어떻게하면 3챕을 진행하다 5챕맵으로 샜는지 모르겠다

5 노가다.
 이런게임에 노가다가? 응 있어.. 스킬렙업하려면 골드겁나까임. 약간 메이플 초창기시절 스탯을 어떻게 찍어야 하는지 몰라서 아무거나 올려버리고 뼈저리게 후회하는 기분을 느끼는마냥 이 게임에서도 적절한 스킬트리를 타는 것이 좀 중요하다. 정말 이부분에서 캐슬크래셔가 떠올랐다.


캐릭터
재미  파이터 = 스나이퍼 > 엔지니어 > 탱커
난이도 파이터 = 스나이퍼 > 엔지니어 > 탱커
-보통 게임 캐릭터에 대해 개발자가 별로 난이도를 부여하지만, 날먹개캐인데 단지 물몸이라는 이유로 난이도가 무지 높다던지 그런 네이버 영화평가에 주작질하는마냥 주작당한 별점으로 인하여 별점에 대한 신뢰도가 바닥인 사람들의 신뢰도를 높은 곳까지 끌어올려주는 갓겜이다.


단점들을 많이 서술하였지만 추천을 박는 이유는 단순하게 저런 불편을 감수하고도 '재미있다' 라는 결론이 나오기 때문이다.

39470296.review:
As the newest game from Cellar Door Games (I loved Rogue Legacy), Full Metal Furies is on my radar since the initial announcement. Initially I wasn't too impressed with the choice of a coop based beat em up, but boy, is this game awesome.

The game has a distinct visual style, and I love the art direction and character design. Everyone has its own charm. Great pixel art characters are put on (hand drawn?) higher resolution scenarios and the result is very pretty for the eyes. Texts and some other elements are a bit blurry, but playing on a full HD monitor I didn't find this problem annoying in the slightest. I barely even notice if we're speaking about scenarios, while it's more noticeable with texts. OST is amazing. A Shell in the Pit has equalled, if not surpassed, the work already done with Rogue Legacy's OST.

The plot is not incredible, as expected from the genre, but from a certain point in the campaign it gets you and becomes pretty interesting. The second half is definitely very good, with more serious themes and some real epicness thrown in the mix. The problem (and I'd say the only problem with the game, aside from network problems which I didn't experience as I played only local coop) is that the writing is pretty inconsistent. The game doesn't take itself seriously for the most part, and there is a lot of humour. Sometimes they got it right, or really right, and it will put a smile on your face or make you laugh a bit, but sometimes (especially in the first part of the campaign, afterwards it gets better) the humour is just so cringeworthy. It's not a big problem in a game like this but it's noticeable. Overall, decent plot with some great protagonists. I love the Furies.

Now for the gameplay: after playing both solo and in couch co-op, I have to say that playing this game is just pure fun and satisfaction. The experience is pretty different thanks to the class swap mechanics, which makes solo play more satisfying yet demanding in terms of skill ceiling. By choosing two classes and alternating them on the fly, you can execute your own custom combos and dish out crazy amounts of damage. Trying all the character/skill combinations is endless fun, and pulling off crazy manouvers is so satisfying it never gets old. Managing the cooldowns of your skills will be essential. In this mode, a bit of grinding may be required, but only if you're levelinng up all the gear and the characters evenly. 

Co-op is simpler in a way, but also pure exhilarating mayhem. Building the chemistry with your partner and finding the perfect combination of characters is the core of the fun, and after a few minutes you'll be hooked. My experience has been this way: we both picked a character we liked after a few experiments, and stuck with them for the rest of the game. It was incredible to see ourselves become masters of our abilities and tools on the way. As a result, we'll surely replay the game with the other two characters.

Secrets and puzzles are pretty complex and satisfying to solve/discover, I definitely didn't expect such hard puzzles in a brawler. Some of them are really creative, too. You'll have to think way outside the box. There are also some hidden pieces of equipment, sometimes hidden a bit too well. I would have loved an hint system for finding some of the more elusive treasures in addition of the hints for the Stone Tablets. 

Overall the progression and the four abilities system makes this brawler deeper than most, and that's why it isn't boring even after extended sessions. This game is a gem with just few issues (and the networking ones will most likely be fixed soon). Absolutely recommended. Easily an 8.5 if you play solo, 9/10 if you can manage to play both solo and in local coop with a trusted buddy.

P.S.: the last three bosses are absolutely mindblowing.

39464780.review:
Here's the deal. The gameplay is amazing. If you liked Castle Crashers or any knockoffs like it before, but felt the playstyle was stale, repetitive, or simply wasn't high skilled enough, FMF fixes this x10. Each character has a nice unique set of abilities, which can change multiple times throughout the story. The music is spectacular, the art direction is great, and the level mechanics are surprisingly deep as well. Playing with 1 other person, the game has ran flawlessly every single time. When I add more though, the host seems to suffer from framerate drops, some weird animation bugs, inability to see/res other players, and general lag. Cellar Door has taken on a big project releasing something like this without a large scale beta test, and because of this we are seeing the results. Does this make the game bad? NO. The game to me is amazingly fun, but without sinking way more hours into it, beating it, and exhausting all the options I cannot give it a score at this time. I am simply chiming in to praise what I've seen so far. Give the developers some time to work out these multiplayer kinks, and don't listen to these "I really wanted to like this, i did," guys.
Worth the 20 dollars without bug fixes/ multiplayer improvement? Yes
Worth the 20 dollars after? Obviously.

I'm not very far in and the game is really fun but I do have a few issues

1. The abilities are unresponsive, it happens very frequently where I push attack, special, or whatever and it doesn't register

2. Movement is hypersensitive and sometimes also unresponsive as I will tell a character to go One Direction but it will continue in the other direction for a couple seconds this has resulted in a fair number of untimely deaths but this could just be a me issue but I'll still list it just in case

3. There's no manual checkpoint, if you mess up you have two options either return to base camp and restart the entire mission or die and restart from checkpoint
If you know things are already going south this would be a huge time-saver to be able to manually restart from checkpoint

4. You can't really play with randos every time I have tried to play online it makes me the host and randos can't join the only option is to invite friends but I could be doing something wrong but I'll still list this

5. The game will randomly start broadcasting without me enabling it and sometimes it will randomly start back up after I close down the game this is a concern for privacy and unnecessary battery usage

Those are my issues but I can't just be negative this game is too awesome for that

So here's some positive stuff

1. The music is amazing, although sometimes it does fade in the background during all the chaos of combat when you hear it it is amazing when I first started up the game I spent a solid 40 minutes just listening to the menu music and I'm highly thinking of buying the OST

2. The visuals are also impressive each enemy is visibly different and they choreograph their attacks and movement quite well everything is soft but solid you can tell what everything is

3. Each class is different fun to play and blend well together I like each character I have met their personalities and little quirks are awesome too

4. Everything is nice and simple but using the simple controls you can pull off some pretty complex stuff and basically juggle enemies around the battlefield when you get some skill

All in all this is a really fun game and I highly recommend buying it especially if you have friends who also have it( it's like Castle Crashers but with roles)

I don't know what the developers have planned but I hope they do have more characters in the future not that that's an issue but I would just like more classes or just new people personally

39460283.review:
Full Metal Furies brings all the fun of every couch game, but like they say: "Not your typical brawler".

This game has tons of features that reivent the Beat'em up game genre. Such as: Being able to switch heroes (making the solo mode more dynamic), better camera positioning, equipment upgrades (rpg style), secret puzzles, funny jokes and cheezy jokes.

They also added barriers on the enemies corresponding to the colour of your hero, so everyone has to cooperate instead of letting the other do the work. Everyone has their time to shine!

You also have co-op mode, where you and 3 other friends against Titans. [b] ATTENTION [/b] To play online you have to befriend randoms... BUT FEAR NOT! They have made an official Discord server so everyone can get people to play, turning randoms into Beat'em up friends!

To finish this review, Full Metal Furies has alot of potential, brings hours of gameplay and it's better with friends (since you fight against Titans and against each other to see who can get the hero you all like)! I strongly recommend this game to every one who wants a game to enjoy with buddies and pass time.

Heads up to the Devellopers!

Enjoy the premise and the action, but the game simply feels like it has something "missing". 

The art direction is fantastic, but actually suffers from its dedication to pixel art. Words on the UI and menu end up looking muddy/blurry as if they aren't in focus due to anti-aliasing. The backgrounds suffer the same gaussian blur appearance, losing some of the vibrance that the game appears to have in trailers. If this was a universal issue with pixel art I'd understand, but I've played PLENTY of titles across PC and console that I simply don't see this issue with.

Single-Player experience can likely be mastered, however I didn't personally find it as fun as I had hoped. Ideally this should be played with 3 other friends to really get that castle crashers vibe. I'd like to get deeper in and give it more time, but given the time window for returns I'm returning to wait and see what changes come to it over time.

Summary: If you and some friends are looking for fun coop, pick it up. If you are looking for a single-player masterpiece akin to their lineage with Rogue Legacy...buy and try with the possibily to return.

As a huge fan of Rogue Legacy, this was an instant buy. It's quite different. Really fun game with lots of style and loads of progression (mostly incremental minor upgrades, but every once in a while you get a game changer through equipment or major talent unlocks). The low res menus are a bit offputting at the start, but the art style in game is wonderful. Combat is interesting and difficult enough to be fun (played solo, I haven't had a chance to MP yet). I don't care much for storylines but the writers have a decent sense of humor and some parts are legitimately funny ([spoiler]I think "The Mexicans?" was the first boss name I've ever laughed at[/spoiler]).

Does not mute itself when in background, which is a minor gripe but something to be aware of if you're like me and alt-tab out of games while working/eating/playing other games/et cetera.

39443062.review:
Initial impressions review! Will fill in later as I get to play more.

After fixing the fact that the game used the integrated graphic card instead of the gaming one on my laptop I had no more technical issues (you actually need a real graphic card to be able to play this game at reasonable FPS, laptop onboard won't do, not even Kaby Lake with an i7 processor. 

I played only in 2 players so far, cleared several areas after the first boss. We are both enjoying the game a lot so far. It's worth pointing out this game doesn't have a Rogue Legacy like progression system. When you die, you lose nothing and just continue from the same area ( checkpoints are everywhere ). So far it doesn't feel like items and talents add a ton of customization variety to the characters, so that type of variety didn't pass over from Rogue Legacy either. Maybe this gets better later on.

The gameplay is still very fun, and the teamplay aspect is as real as they advertise it. At first we were completely lost about how things work and what we should be doing, but after a couple of hours we started to get the hang of it. I realized the tank can actually block aoe, and everything with her shield, even often while pointing in the wrong direction, and from that point on everything was much easier. Currently in the second area, after an hour or so, we didn't die once yet, and I needed 200 deaths to beat Rogue Legacy, so I'm not a very skilled action game player. The game could end up being on the easy side, but we will see.

The music is great, the ingame art is fantastic as usual.

One thing I dislike is the way the story progresses, with a lot of click through dialogue that makes it almost feel like a visual novel at times. Rogue Legacy had subtle humor, and the story was served in small chunks as filler, rather than interrupting your gameplay every few minutes. Also, every line from every character tries so hard to sound funny, and for the most part, it doesn't succeed. Also as beautiful the ingame graphics and Kotaki's pixel art are, the dialogue art for the characters feels crude and cheap. 

I also don't like the fact I was charged 20 euros rather than $20 for the game, because US $ is currently 0.82 of euro. But this is probably Steam charging policy. Still worth pointing out to potential buyers out there. $24 is not a small amount for an indy game, but I still think  it's worth it. 

So far 8/10. It's a different genre from Rogue Legacy, it's a team game to play with friends for the most part, but due to it's learning curve and initial difficulty it might not be the party game where casual and non-gamer buddies get a controller and everyone has fun. It's still a game for gamers primarily, which personally, I enjoy of course.

39441574.review:
Incredibly fun game. Tons to unlock, collect and discover. The heroines are all fun to control, and each feels unique and fun to play with. Solo is very fun with the character swap feature, and online multiplayer is a blast.

My only gripe is the colored shields when playing online. It's a huge pain in the butt that you just cannot do damage to enemies that don't match your color, especially if that teammate is downed. In singleplayer, the mechanic was actually fun. But in multiplayer, it would be nice to be able to do reduced damage, or have some other mechanic come into play instead.

I also had a few bugs in multiplayer, peers (not the host) would occasionally see phanom enemies, and character select mid-game would often de-sync and disconnected players, and freeze the host session.

Overall, the pros outweigh the cons, and the developers seem serious about fixing these day 1 issues. I highly suggest buying it. If you are leery about the bugs, put this bad boy on your wishlist and wait a week or two.

**Apparently there's network issues, resulting in most of the negative review. I've only played local, so it's doesn't apply to me**

This is a pretty awesome take on brawlers. They do a couple cool new things to make the moment to moment gameplay more interesting.

1. First, if you're playing single player you get to pick TWO heroes not one. This leads to some interesting combos of attacks. There's animation cancels you can do. You get crits for juggling people. You'll catch yourself swapping back and forth while your other hero's moves are on cool down.
2. The unlocks you get change the gameplay quite a bit. Early example: You can change your DPS's jump so that it goes way higher and has a longer cooldown. BUT it has a much larger radius and knocks people up into the air for juggle combos.


Ok onto the questionable things.
1. The dialogue and humor kind of sucks. It's a cross between bad puns and "fellow kids". LUCKILY someone on the dev team knows this and there is an option where you can disable ALL non-critical dialogue.

2. I worry it's going to have that brawler problem where you can have under-leveled characters. Like if you don't enjoy the sniper character, but you NEED her later on. You'll have to go back to early levels just to grind for gold and XP. Can't say this with 100% certainty because i haven't finished the campaign yet.
